thread.title: Marko Dano to Rockford, Bryan Bickell placed on waivers as Blackhawks trim roster
thread.title_full: Marko Dano to Rockford, Bryan Bickell placed on waivers as Blackhawks trim roster - Chicago Tribune

author: Chris Hine
title: Marko Dano to Rockford, Bryan Bickell placed on waivers as Blackhawks trim roster
text:
The Blackhawks trimmed their roster as the season-opener looms on Wednesday and there were a few surprises in the list of cuts.
The Hawks assigned newly-acquired winger Marko Dano to Rockford to begin the season with Viktor Tikhonov and Kyle Baun beating out Dano for a roster spot and a source told the Tribune the Hawks also placed winger Bryan Bickell on waivers.
The Hawks have been trying to trade Bickell and his contract, which carries a $4 million cap hit over the next two seasons, since the offseason began.
TSN first reported the Hawks placed Bickell on waivers. Presumably, if Bickell clears waivers and is assigned to Rockford, one of the forwards assigned there could take his place on the roster. If Bickell clears waivers and is assigned to Rockford, the Hawks stand to recoup $950,000 in salary-cap space.
The Hawks also placed goaltender Michael Leighton on waivers, according to a source.
In addition to Dano those players are Ryan Hartman, Vincent Hinostroza, Brandon Mashinter, Dennis Rasumssen and Garrett Ross. Defensemen Erik Gustafsson and Ville Pokka were also assigned to Rockford.
With Michal Rozsival and Kyle Cumiskey injured, it would appear David Rundblad, Viktor Svedberg and Trevor van Riemsdyk will make up the back end of the blue line for the Hawks to start the season. Duncan Keith, Brent Seabrook, Trevor Daley and Niklas Hjalmarsson are the top four.
